group_1.textLeft: Yoo-hoo!
...Wait, what? Where's Shizushizu?
It's rare for you guys to be separated.

group_1.textRight: Oh, right...she has some stuff she's dealing with.
We wanted to speak with Miss Yayoi.@Is there a way we can contact her?

group_1.textLeft: Kanochin? Sure, I can hit her up, but what for?
What's going on?
So it's about her wish...
Ooh, my bad, I prolly shouldn't have said that...

group_1.textRight: No, it was something that she'd inevitably@have to confront.
Yeah...there's no running away from your@own wish.

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah.
I see, Kanoko might know something about@the impact of those failed negotiations.
That's why you're trying to find her, right?

group_1.textRight: Yes.

group_1.textLeft: I get it! You're trying to talk to the people@who were directly involved!

group_1.textRight: Eh?! Directly involved?
How so?!

group_1.textLeft: Hm?
You know, like, the people she saved with@her wish...?

group_1.textRight: The ones she saved...?
Not the ones she put out of business...?

group_1.textLeft: No, not them! I mean, remember what@Kanochin said?

group_1.textRight: Though a while ago, our factory was in@hot water...

group_1.textLeft: Oh, really? What happened?

group_1.textRight: It's a long story, but...I guess I could say that@basically, the whole industry was in deep trouble.
But everything's fine now.
Now that you mention it...
But what does that have to do with that@economic summit or the joint statement?

group_1.textLeft: Take it away, Myako-senpai!

group_1.textRight: Emiri...

group_1.textLeft: Like, I know Kanochin was saying "oh noes,@our business was totally in big trouble,"
buuuut I don't really remember all the little@details about what was up!
Help me out here!
*Sigh* Well, to put it simply...
Since those economic agreements in other nations@broke down, Japanese industry averted disaster.

group_1.textRight: That's what I read in the paper, but I didn't@really get it...
It doesn't seem like it changed anything at all.

group_1.textLeft: That's just it, though - for Japan, it's GOOD@that nothing changed.

group_1.textRight: What do you mean by that...?
Do you mean that it made Japan a better place?

group_1.textLeft: Not quite. Hmm...it's more like it maintained@the status quo.

group_1.textRight: That's exactly what Mom said. Can you explain?

group_1.textLeft: I don't know all the nitty-gritty details, but...
If that joint statement had been enacted, it@would've impacted Japanese industry very badly.
Kanoko said that small-to-medium-sized factories would have been particularly devastated.
In other words, Shizuka's wish protected@a ton of people, didn't it?
Like, a whole bunch of people almost lost their@jobs, but she stopped it from happening?

group_1.textRight: That's amazing, isn't it?

group_1.textLeft: It is.

group_1.textRight: Then why couldn't find anything regarding it?

group_1.textLeft: I guess it's because there was nothing to report.
Nothing happened to the country,@so everyone forgot about it.
Oh yeah, I get it!
It's like, if you prevented a murder,
there'd be no case, so that means the@news wouldn't talk about it!

group_1.textRight: Ah, I see...

group_1.textLeft: You're not wrong, but that's kind of a@messed-up comparison...

group_1.textRight: Charu...!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...!

group_1.textRight: Um...do you think we could talk to the@people who were affected by this?

group_1.textLeft: We want to hear the story of someone@who was saved.
I think it'd do a lot to cheer up Shizuka!
Maybe Kanochin - no, wait, maybe@Kanochin's dad could help?
But now we have to figure out how to approach him.@If we bring this up out of nowhere, he'll get leery.

group_1.textRight: You have a point...

group_1.textLeft: ...Oh! My homework!

group_1.textRight: Your homework...?

group_1.textLeft: My geography homework!
It's just that I have to write up a short paper on@industries and factories and stuff.

group_1.textRight: Let's see...it's about the effects of industry and@factories on our region.

group_1.textLeft: One of my classmates said their dad knows@someone who works at a local factory,
so I was really excited to talk to them, except...

group_1.textRight: Oh, we can say it's an interview…!

group_1.textLeft: Now that it seems like we got a good excuse,
I'll ask Kanochin!
